page.title: 07TRANSPORT, SERVICE STATION
page.content: The garage on the northbound carriageway of the A19 has facilities for repairing vehicles and has its own breakdown truck. It is approved by the RAC and the AA.The garage sells and also provides storage for caravans. The garage shop sells car parts, oil, cigarettes,sweets and soft drinks. On the forecourt both petrol and diesel oil can be purchased. The owner sells only one brand of petrol and estimates that he disposes of 6,000 litres in a day. The petrol tanker visits the garage twice a week. Customers put in their own petrol and then pay at the shop. They receive vouchers for mugs or glasses if they buy more than Â£5 worth of petrol. The garage which ahs been open for twenty years serves up to three hundred customers per day.
